rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment reports case details factually without using high-potency verbs or metaphors.
The segment uses outcome verbs ('linked', 'sick or infected') and counts ('Six of the 16 reported human cases'), not significant scale/impact.
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
The segment reports factual numbers without explicit calming language.
Segment does not contain a minimiser used with a scale contrast.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
The segment reports data on cases and exposure source.
The segment reports numerical metrics '2024', 'Six of the 16 reported human cases' using standard verbs.
